page.title: 01Summary of the area.
page.content: The area around{ALFRED'S TOWER}was a centre where many forts and castles were built. In fact there is even a convent and a priory in the area. This area was a centre of great historical activity in the past. The prime reason that all these historical buildings were constructed in such an area was that the area is hilly and wooded. Therefore it is no wonder there was such building activity in the area. But the land is also fairly flat at the bottom of these steep hills. On these flats there is little wood, but mainly grass fields.There are several farms in the area, indicating that this area is largely used for agriculture. There is one hamlet in the area which has an inn. The area has seven well spaced farms. The trees are mainly coniferous but there are a few deciduous areas.
